comments:
When doing a New>Visual Class on a project that doesn't have the SWT container
added, the creation wizard allows me to select SWT options.  It creates the
class correctly, but since the SWT var isn't on the project classpath, it
doesn't revolve Shell correctly.

We shouldn't be generating code that doesn't work out of the box.  Discussed
with Peter briefly as to a solution and there were two possible ones:
1) We disable the SWT options if the project's classpath doesn't have SWT stuff
on it.
2) We add the SWT container to the project's classpath and allow the user to
select the SWT items from the tree.

When I do this, I also get the following stack trace...
